data.title: Music History Events: Births
data.meta_description: List of events in music history for the category Births
data.text:
Composer Samuel Barber is born in West Chester, Pennsylvania.

Jazz guitarist Jean "Django" Reinhardt is born in Belgium.

The French conductor Jean Martinon is born in Lyon, France.

Singer-songwriter Johnny Mercer is born in Savannah, Georgia. Composed '40s hits like "One for My Baby (and One More for the Road)," and "That Old Black Magic," and added lyrics to popular instrumentals like "Laura," "Midnight Sun," and "Satin Doll."

Jazz drummer Cozy Cole is born William Randolph Cole in East Orange, New Jersey.

Trumpeter/bandleader Larry Clinton is born in Brooklyn, New York.

Composer/arranger Hugo Winterhalter is born in Wilkes-Barre, Pennsylvania.

Inventor Leo Fender, who founded Fender Musical Instruments, is born in Anaheim, California.

Harriet Nelson is born Peggy Lou Snyder in Des Moines, Iowa. Before starring on the long-running sitcom The Adventures of Ozzie and Harriet, alongside husband Ozzie Nelson, Harriet works as a singe and actress under contract with RKO Studios.

Colonel Tom Parker, the controversial talent manager who managed Elvis Presley's career, is born Andreas Cornelis van Kuijk in Breda, Netherlands.

Burl Ives is born in Jasper County, Illinois.

Delta bluesman "Papa Charlie" McCoy is born in Jackson, Mississippi.

Maybelle Carter, matriarch of The Carter Family clan and mother to June Carter Cash, is born Maybelle Addington in Nickelsville, Virginia.

Carmen Miranda is born Maria do Carmo Miranda da Cunha in Marco de Canaveses, Portugal.

Jazz drummer Gene Krupa is born in Chicago, Illinois.

Jazz trombonist Quentin "Butter" Jackson is born in Springfield, Ohio. He starts his music career playing with Cab Calloway and later the Duke Ellington Orchestra.

Victor Borge - pianist, conductor and comedian - is born Borge Rosenbaum in Copenhagen, Denmark.

Johnny Green, songwriter, composer, arranger and conductor, is born in New York City. Known for his 1930 composition "Body and Soul."

Duke Ellington's innovative trumpeter Cootie Williams is born in Mobile, Alabama.

Bandleader Louis Jordan, whose jazz and blues music leads to rock and roll, is born in Brinkley, Arkansas.

Jazz musician Lionel Hampton is born in Louisville, Kentucky.

Composer and arranger Percy Faith is born in Toronto, Ontario, Canada.

Jazz vibraphonist Red Norvo is born Kenneth Norville in Beardstown, Illinois.

Violinist Stephane Grappelli, who forms the jazz group Quintette du Hot Club de France along with guitarist Django Reinhardt, is born in Paris, France.

Comedian and cornet player Ish Kabibble is born Merwyn Bogue in North East, Pennsylvania. He borrows his stage name from the novelty song "Isch ga-bibble," a play on a Yiddish expression meaning "I should worry?"

Broadway entertainer Ethel Merman is born Ethel Agnes Zimmermann in Astoria, Queens.

Russ Columbo is born Ruggiero Eugenio di Rodolfo Colombo in Camden, New Jersey.

Jazz singer Cab Calloway is born Cabell Calloway III in Rochester, New York. He would grow up in Baltimore, Maryland.

Connee Boswell (of the '30s jazz trio The Boswell Sisters) is born in Kansas City, Missouri.

Songwriter, arranger Buck Ram is born Samuel Ram in Chicago, Illinois. Known for his work with The Platters, among other greats like Ella Fitzgerald, Duke Ellington and Glenn Miller. (You can also spot him under the pseudonyms Ande Rand, Lynn Paul and Jean Miles.)
